item.title: Ticket #1802 (Underscores not valid in CSS class/id names) created
item.dc:creator: dougal
item.description:
We're generating class names like "current_page_item", which are invalid in CSS. The underscores should be replaced with dashes.

I'm flagging this for version 1.6, but this is present in the 1.5 codebase, too. So if we do another 1.5 point release (unlikely, though I know we considered it), we might as well patch it there, too.

item.title: Ticket #1686 (CSS Security Vulnerability) updated
item.dc:creator: dougal
item.description:
So, basically, a user with high enough privileges to mess with your system can mess with your system?

Would filtering the URL with wp_specialchars() fix this "bug"?

item.title: Ticket #1800 (Highlight current category) created
item.dc:creator: amanzi
item.description:
I raised a suggestion in the wp-testers mailing to change the list_cats function so that if browsing a category page, the current category is highlighted in the list_cats output.

With the help of Ryan Boren and David House we came up with this patch, that changes the list_cats function in the wp-includes/template-functions-category.php file.

Bookmarket in 1.6 is still very incomplete:

  1. Title and post contents aren't populated. (fixed!)

item.title: Ticket #1798 (Numbering of Import Links (Blogroll) is confusing) created
item.dc:creator: h3h
item.description:
On the new "Import Links" screen under the Links section in the admin panel, the steps are numbered linearly. These steps need to be completely reorganized.

Steps 1 and 2 aren't steps, but helpful hints on how to find a URL to an OPML file.

Steps 3 and 4 aren't steps that can occur together, so they should not be linear.

I see this as a simple dichotomy: Specify a URL to an OPML File *or* Upload an OPML File.

If the person wants to specify a URL, hints are given about blogrolling.com or blo.gs and there is a text box for the URL of the OPML file.

Else if the person wants to upload an OPML file, there is a file input element.

Then there is one submit button that will submit the entire form.

UI on this could be much nicer (e.g. 2 columns, one for each possible path). I'll throw something together if I find time.

item.title: Ticket #1784 (Upload directories created with wrong permissions) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: This can vary from host to host. Some need 777, some need 775, and others need 755. Maybe we should stat() wp-content/ to get its mode and use that mode for all of the subdirs of wp-content. I believe our installation instructions indicate that the user needs to change permissions on wp-content so that it is writable by the server. Thus, we can take our cue from wp-content.

item.title: Ticket #1795 (404 on preview of future dated posts) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: I think we should show it only in a preview context, and we should show it to any who has edit capabilities for that post.

item.title: Ticket #1796 (Session Saver inserts date in Write Post password field) created
item.dc:creator: donncha
item.description: As reported by Lorelle, and reproduceable: when Firefox is closed the Session Saver plugin records the tabs that were open and opens them again when Firefox is restarted. Unfortuantely, if the Write Post screen is loaded, it inserts the date in the password field. Not sure how we can fix this, but having value="" in the password input tag might fix it.

item.title: Ticket #1795 (404 on preview of future dated posts) created
item.dc:creator: donncha
item.description: Future dated posts won't preview in the "Write Post" preview window. Maybe we need to make a change so that the post author can see a post, regardless of what date it's to be published on?
